intro: Navarretia polycladon, commonly known as the Sierra snowplant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pink flowers in late spring. The plant thrives in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is known for its ability to survive in harsh, arid climates. Navarretia polycladon plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing nectar for pollinators.
